alert.note: Alert for Bristol (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 18 at 9:02AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WORCESTER...SOUTHWESTERN NORFOLK...NORTHWESTERN BRISTOL AND NORTHEASTERN PROVIDENCE COUNTIES... At 901 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Lincoln, or over Cumberland, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Woonsocket, Cumberland, Franklin, North Attleborough, Attleboro, Mansfield, Norton, Foxborough, Bellingham, and Seekonk around 905 AM EDT. Walpole around 910 AM EDT. Sharon, Medway, and Millis around 915 AM EDT. Easton around 920 AM EDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
